text: Couleur orangée, mousse moyennement durable, nez houblonné sur les fruits tropicaux de manière assez subtile. Plutôt décevant en bouche par contre si on attend le seigle. On reste sur les fruits tropicaux mais de manière trop légère pour être réellement appréciable. Je suis déception.

Bottle. Pours a gold-orange with slight bubbly white head. Some nice citrus in this one - grapefruit and melon. Give it all a soft texture. Spruce hop finish, but light. Finishes nice and easy - you could drink a lot of these. Good stuff, well-balanced.

Fresh aroma of hoppy citrus and a lot of tropical fruits. Taste is sweet and malty, going through the IPA obvious range(tropical fruits, pine, hops) but adding a subtle hint of rye. Juicy and interesting. Dry, bitter finish. Very good!

Color dorado anaranjado, translúcido, con capa de espuma blanca de dos dedos de grosor (retención decente). Carbonatación media. Textura oleosa. Aroma ligeramente tropical y a centeno. Sabor lupulado, fuerte, con golpazo final de centeno. Amargor suave. Ni fu ni fa.

Lovely tropical fruit nose. 
Pours dark amber like a rye ale should. 
Plenty of fruit flavours with a hint of earthiness.
Pleasant smooth, lasting finish. 
Pretty decent stuff.

Orange gold pour with a thick off-white head which settles to about 1cm, quite a few suspended floaters. Aroma is orange, a little spice, rye bread. Taste is orange, spicy, passionfruit, starts sweet but then a marmaladey, bitter finish. This is damn good.

Slightly hazy orange color with off-white head. Aroma has dried oranges, earthy/resiny hops and multigrain bread. Taste starts with resiny hops and some orange, continues with spicy rye and finishes with bitter grapefruit peel and resiny hops. Medium body and carbonation. Overall its a quite nice, bitter and spicy IPA.

Draft 0.25l at The Watering Hole Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 06.04.2017. Pour it hazy golden color with small white head. Aroma nice rye with pleasent fruit feel. Taste nice easy drinkable, fresh, light rye bread, hoppy tropical fruits, pine, mango, medium body, slick feel, after taste bready, nice easy drinkable. Good!

Draft at Craft Beer Co Clerkenwell. Great clear amber color with a frothy one-finger light khaki head. Aroma is rye, tropical/citrus hops, caramel. Flavor is nicely sweet yet with a good tropical hop bitterness on the finish and spicy rye notes. Medium-bodied with a standard feel. Have to give high marks because this is one of the better rye beers Ive had. Really nice and balanced.

Lovely scent of sweetness and tropical fruits. Fabulous taste of sweetness, tropical fruit and perfectly balanced bitterness. Exquisite bitterness that fills the mouth forever. This beer is perfection for my taste buds. Easy to drink and well balanced. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Great zesty fruit aroma, clean tasting , with a touch of complexity and spice from the rye. Delicious bitter finish

5/II/17 - 33cl bottle @ Brugs Bierfestival - BB: 28/XI/17 (2017-115) Thanks to 77ships for sharing the bottle!
Clear deep gold to orange beer, creamy irregular yellow head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lovely, some tropical fruits, cheesy hops, caramel malts, bit sweet, dank, ripe papaya. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bitter start, grapefruit, lychee, papaya, lots of passion fruit, citrus, nice bitterness, very fruity. Aftertaste: more passion fruit, bitter, hoppy, dank, resinous, lots of pineapple juice, citrus, grapefruit, some alcohol, very nice!
33 cl. bottle. Hazy dark amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, citrus, spice, malt, bitterness and citrus.

Hazy dark amber beer, smooth white head. Tangy, tropical fruit aroma. Flavour has a light sweetness with a hint of caramel before bitter tropical fruit kicks in. Dry, slightly bready. Crisp and tasty, just a light, slightly sour aftertaste. Smashing.

Bottle from Boxbeers.dk. Pours light copper-brown with a mediumsized fluffy head. Aroma is oranges, pine, juicy malt, lightly toasty wood/rye. Taste is massive resin bitterness, moderate spicy toasty malt, dry and bitter finish. Oily texture, little carbonation. Very nice!. my 500th rating
Bottle.Hazy orange colour with medium White head.Aroma is hoppy and fruity with flavors of mandarin and lemon good refreshing and mild bitter finish.

Bottle, Oddbins West Hampstead. Lightish slightly orange amber, hint of haze. A textbook example of a nice hoppy rye ale, spicy tangy rich malt with a nice crunchy orangey citrus pine hop bitterness. Splendid.
Thnx to Tderoeck and 77ships for sharing the beers ! Pours unclear blonde, small white head. Smell is green hops. Taste is full, hops, green , decently bitter. Malty, not bad.

Draught at Bootleggers Craft Beer Bar, Copenhagen. Dark amber colour with a thin, light tanned head. Fruity aroma with citrus fruits, spicy notes from rye malts, caramel malts, toasted notes. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and an average carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with citrus fruits and spicy, rye notes. Lovely Rye beer.

330 ml. bottle shared. BBF 28.11.2017. Hazy orange, little head. Nose is dank cheese hop oil, raw with quite a bit rye malt, faint agave, tropical fruits are lost. taste is lightly cheesy, hop is low, tropical fruits seem absent, there is some pine, rye malt is upfront, mellow, bready malt qualities, body is substantial rye. Overall interesting malt profile, oddly malt forward but good in the end with low cheesy & pine hops. Tropical fruit description on the label led me to expect something quite different.

F: not big, white, quick gone.
C: gold, hazy.
A: malt, tropical fruits, mango, pineapple, peach, hint of yeast.
T: malt, light tropical fruits, hint of bread, pine resin, grassy, medium body, medium carbonation, very good one, 33cl bottle, Thanks to the BE RB crew for sharing beers today!

Keg at the Tate, cloudy orange-amber with a small tight head. Nose is resin, pineapple and grapefruit, faint spice. Body is smooth and slightly milky, then turning more bitter with notes of resin, spiced tangerine (reminiscent of mulled wine), a hint of toffee, grapefruit bitterness, a little rye bread, just a tad too gassy but otherwise excellent and very more-ish.
Bottle from Siren brewery. Pours cloudy deep amber with fluffy white head. Aroma very fruity - pineapple, papaya, tangerine - and full of cereal and resin. Beautifully balanced and tasty.

Bottle from honestbrew. Hazy gold to orange color. Thin white head. Medium body. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet. Aroma is hops, chili, pineapple. Flavour is is pinneapple, rye, mango, passion fruit. Great!

Bottle from Brewcraft, drank at home the day after Full Moon. Pours a light dull copper-brown with medium fluffy smooth head. Smells very nice - orange, huge pine, juicy malt, lightly toasty wood/rye. Taste is massive resin bitterness, moderate spicy toasty malt, deeply dry and very bitter finish. Body is oily, little carbonation, stony bitter bite. Very good.

Bottle from Brewcraft at home. Hazy dull orange pour with fine white head. Aroma is rich tangerine sweet and bitter, some sort of oaky sweetness too. Really nice. Taste follows - less zesty and more bitter, with some slightly spicy orange and bready malt. Smooth palate. Another good IPA from Siren, like the Proteus.

Tap @ Charlies w friends/old DTU. Appearance: clear golden with ok white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: grain, light rye, biscuit, citrus, orange and grapefruit. palette: strong hoppy aroma, light carbonation, medium body, medium sweetness, balanced by an average bitterness, medium to long duration and a watery texture. Overall: nice ale, with hoppy and rye character.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2017 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */øernes. Pours almost clear golden with lazing offwhite head. Aroma is light malty with biscuit and hoppy with resin, pine and tropical fruit. Taste is semi-sweet malty with biscuit and light bread and hoppy with pine, resin and tropical fruits. Finish is balanced malty, hoppy and quite dry.

On tap at Brewdog Birmingham on 23-Dec-2016, poured into a snifter. Orange amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma of sweet malt, tropical fruit, pine and spices. Medium body and carbonation. Great fresh rye and hoppy taste, with grapefruit and a big malty backbone. Pretty good.

2/3 6 degrees north Edinburgh. Pours orange, thin head with islands of foam. Aroma of oranges, spice, earth. Nice full mouthfeel. Really interesting: part rye IPA, part farmhouse ale, hints of something like a barley wine. Taste is a nice mix of rye, citrus, caramel, yeasty funky. Bloody good this.
Aroma of citrus with pineapple and hops. Cloudy orange yellow. Taste is hoppy with the citrus and pineapple also. Nice balanced mouth. Tap
Amber, almost clear, good white head and lacing. Medium body. Crisp, bitter finish, after plenty of tropical fruit, toffee malt and some pine.
Hazy, nice head, fruity aroma, caramel, honey, peach, yeast, sourish, fruity flavor, caramel, honey, bitter, yeasty, light sweetness, medium bodied.

Great orange/brown color, with some fizzy carbonation w/ a solid foamy head and lacing. Great look. The smell is great, can tell it is going to be a good one. Complex, hoppy, rye, citrus, sweetness. Taste is Earthy hops, with some rye.. no real sweetness on the taste. Not overly bitter, somewhat creamy mouthfeel. Its a great one.

33cl bottle shared. Appearance: Hazy orange, with an average sized off-whitehead. Aroma: Malts, rye, citrus (grapefruit, oranges). Taste moderate sweet and bitter, slightly bitter in the finish taste palate follows the aroma.. moderate body and carbonation.

Hazy light amber color with frothy and strong sugar foam. Aromas are mainly hoppy, does remond of new world hops, quite sweet, fruity of pineapple and honey. Palate, full body with thick smooth texture leaving somewhat warming, bit hop harsh finish. Taste is mainly bittersweet of american hops with hints of heavy but not bitter malts. Overall, nice and very good beer! Do recomend!
Bottle. Medium white head. Cloudy burnt orange body. Tangerines, chocolate malt, bubblegum, some must. Bitter and tangy. Some alcohol, some sugar. Dry finish.
Deep amber with a white head. Juicy and fruity aroma and flavours, moderate bitterness, mild rye spiciness. Good beer.

On tap at Camba Tap House 2016-3 and bottled skindly shared by impuritylaw, merci. Canned gooseberry in its syrup in aroma, pineapple, a whiff only of spicy-sweet rye, dank Simcoe and more berries. Manages to stay well attenuated and refreshing despite the sweetish malt base and exotic pineapple/green grapey berry. Catty finish, veering into potpourri soap bar, dried apricot and a hint of vanilla. Well done. - In the draught version has more dank hops, going on cheese and yoghurt infused with green grape peel - and oddly a thinner body with less rye than the bottled version.

Bardzo gładkie przyjemne i smaczne piwo.
Piana piękna drobna i zbita. Kolor złoty lekko mętny.
Aromat cytrusowy z wyraźnym grejpfrutem.
Goryczka lekka bardzo dobrze zbalansowana.
Żyto robi robotę świetne piwo.

JAAA!!!! Exotisch, trotzdem rund und doch wieder total abgefahren. In allen Bereichen!!!! Riecht und schmeckt auffällig nach Pot. Wahnsinn!!!! Getrunken im CAFE DE KOFFER Groningen 25cl/4,30Euro und wirklich jeden Cent wert.
Cask @ Old Gate, Hebden Bridge. Deep amber with a creamy head. Strong, with its strength evident in a fairly stated aroma a d taste in this respect.

33cl bottle at home. Hazy dark orange with a medium white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Tasty bitterness with nice fruity sweetness. Pine, rye, citrus, tropical fruits, some grapefruit and grain. Damn good!

From tap at De Koffer, Groningen. Aroma is strong rye, malty, pine resin, fruity hops, citrus, orange, herbal notes, lots of rye. Flavour is about moderate sweet with a good over medium bitter finish. Above medium body. Excellent rye beer, lovely strong rye taste with some nice fruity hoppy elements.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey to celebrate Erics last night behind the bar. Clear golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of rye, citrus, tropical fruit, light malt, floral notes. Tastes of citrus, tropical fruit, floral notes, stone fruit. Medium body with a dry finish. Very tasty rye IPA.
Hazy dark-orange color with tan head. Aroma is peachy, resinous. Taste is sweet peaches, resinous, sweet jam, nice residual sweetness. Smooth mouthfeel. Where is the Rye spiciness?
Hell getreidig malziger Antrunk. Etwas herb, steigend trocken dunkel, leicht würzig. Spritzig, nass hopfig. 11/10/11/11//11

Very nicely balanced hops nd malt pale ale - always great to drink one thats not just a hop bomb. Citrus and rye. Hazy maroon pour. Tangy finish with hint of candy. Very drinkable stuff. Tap at churchkey.

Keg @ Bishops Arms, Folkungagatan. Hazy dark orange with a rich lacing white head. Nice hoppy aroma, pineapple, grapefruit, resin and pine. Rich and smooth mouthfeel. Hoppy taste with a great malt backbone, pine, resin, orange, citrus zest, rye, earthy yeast and caramel malt. Really smooth still finish dry and that pleasant bitterness lingers. Well made!

Bottle from Uiltje webshop, BB 051116 batch G506, large sample. Hazy orange color, short frothy head leaving some lacing. Aroma of oots of tropical fruit, citrus, peach, some grainy cookie. Medium bitterness, bit citrussy, dry grainy biscuit. Easy drinkable, seems a bit thin even for 7%. Fruitiness is good though.
Bottle. Dark orange with a small head. Big orange and tropical fruit aroma. Bready malt with a bit of rye, dry spiciness leads to loads of orange, mango and pineapple hops. Gently bitter finish.
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Hazy amber coloured with a rich orange and tropical fruit flavour followed by bitter pine, orange marmalade and a smooth creamy bitter red fruity finish. Superb!

Bottle @ Van Moll Brewpub shared by Joes. Hazy orange color, average sized off-white to beige head. Smell and taste malts, rye I guess, citrus, some grapefruit. Decent body and carbonation. Not bad at all. Quite nice.
Origin: Tap. Vessel: Nonic. Supplier: The Beer Emporium (Bristol). Hoppy with notes of honey.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ XXXII The Great Power of Beer & Wine, Sevilla, España.
A: Hazy amber / Ambar turbio.
T/S: Hops, rye, fruity / Lupulo, centeno, afrutado.
From a bottle at home. Murky amber with a small head. Very aromatic, orangey with some tropical fruit hit. Big flavours of bitter (seville) orange and mango with spicey rye. Drying on the finish.

Third, keg, sample tray, at Brewdog Clapham Junction. Amber-red in body colour. Off-white head, crocheted lacing. Inviting red oranges on the nose. Succulent taste of orange, bread and a touch of coffee. Malt-fruity bitterness to a lingering ending. Fine bodied. Very nice (Battersea, London 29.11.2015).
Fra keg på Brewdog Clapham Junction 29 Nov 15. Nesten svart. Et svakt rødskjær. Lavt, litt farget skum. Spotlacing. Søt fruktig aroma. Smaken lett metallisk. Tørr behagelig fruktig avslutning.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy amber with an initially foamy off white head, mostly fading. Aroma of pine, tropical fruits, orange, mango. Taste is of oranges, mango, pineapple, pine, burnt finish with a hint of spice. Thin, slightly oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

33cl bottle from the brewery, with a stated ABV of 7%.  A hazy amber pour with a billowing white head that settles back quite quickly; sweet and fruity aroma of mango and mandarin; spicy bitter taste with the rye balancing the tropical fruits well; then a lengthy citrus bitterness to finish. Full of taste and very easy drinking.
Bottle. Pours murky amber. Aroma is mango, orange zest and some sweetish malt. Taste is light biterness with hints of sweetness. Not bad.
Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Tom L. Hazy yellow. Aroma - spicy with some green and floral hops. Flavors of sweet malt, fruits, spicy, rye bread, sour-bitter dry finish. Medium-bodied.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Tom L. Cloudy golden. Aroma of slightly stale fruity hops, some spicy rye. Flavor has some sweetish malt, spicy rye, and bitter stale hops. Medium-bodied.
Pours golden/copper coloured, no head, slight lacing. Aroma is tangerine, grapefruit, mango. Taste is citrus bitterness that lingers. Smooth palate and medium carbonation. Very pleasant.

Appearance is amber, with a large foamy pure white head which fairly quickly diminishes. Aroma- orange hints, grapefruit, some mango, zesty, malty, a bit wheaty, vague hint of honey sweetness. Taste- bitter fruits, hops, orange peel, sugary hints, fairly full in the mouth. Good stuff.

A wonderfully sweet aroma similar to long discontinued mandarin and mango Lilt. A lovely sweet taste full of fruit awaits, before a hard hitting bitter taste with peppery tones from the rye. Fantastic.
25.1.2015. Aroma of passionfruit, mango, berries. Flavour is sweetish with further exotic fruits and citrus. Tasty, fresh.

From tap at the Local Pub, Athens. Holden orange color with off white head. Malty aroma, rye, caramel, hoppy light citrus and pine. Sweet and bitter taste, more hoppy (pine again) than the aroma, caramel, light sweet fruity notes. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Cask at the hanging bat. Pours hazy reddish brown, dry and peppery, light fruit, light toffee, dry bitter finish.

Bottled. Pours deep golden with an average off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit, peach, mango and rye. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice rye IPA.
Tried at Stallyktan in Örebro. Fruity and hoppy smell with tropical fruits. Similar taste. Very fruity and tropical, like a tropical juice.

Draught @ The Rover. Pours very hazy yellowish goldenish brown with a frothy and bubbly offwhite head that leaves some sparse thick trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is tiny malty and fruity with dark rye bread, caramel, grapefruit juice, pineapple, freshly cut grass, pine needles, moist soil, black pepper corns and lemon zest. Taste is slightly bitter, tiny malty and fruity with dark rye bread, wholegrain crackers, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, grapes,freshly cut grass, pine needles, moist soil, black currant leaves, watermelon skin and lemon zest. Mouthfeel is soft, tiny astringent and medium bodied. Finish is bitter with dark rye bread, grapefruit, pineapple, grapes, grass, pine needles, moist soil, water melon skin and lemon zest. Nicely fruity rye ipa. Enjoyable!

CASK, yes, CASK, damn it! A real rare one! At my local Ale House Chelmsford, 13th February 2015. Good lacing, golden colour. Loads of pine and pilth on Aroma. Mangos, grapefruit and onion. Taste is mango juice, tropical fruit juice, tutti fruity, lemons, good clean malt. Dry and fruity finish. Incredibly hoppy. One awesome beer! Ryan, I salute you!

Gran bella birea, tantissimi agrumi al naso, frutra tropicale ed aghi di pino freschi. In bocca è agrumata e amara, benissimo come bilanciamento e le sensazioni retrolfattive sono pressappoco meravigliose, con una nota fortemente balsamica che rende splendida la bevuta. Grandissima birra
Cask at the Lamb & Flag, Oxford. Pour is amber, aroma is fruity, floral. Taste is rye, fruity, sweet, floral, malty, gentle bitterness. Very nice
Pours golden, quite clear with a bit of foam. Aroma is dry, sweet and fruity. Taste has also some fruits, but not that heavy. Dry, piney and really bitter. Spicy and nice kick of hops.
Light Amber color. Excellent rye and passionfruit sweet malty nose. Medium body with fairly spicy rye notes. Decent bitterness with lots of rye.
Color hazy orange with small white head. Aroma peach, citrus, herbal. Taste fruits, grapefruit, hoppy.

Bottle from Oddbins. 
Appearance - cloudy amber with a neatly laced head. 
Nose - mandarin maybe apricots. Light creamy backdrop. 
Taste - bitter seville orange into dried apricot.
Palate - medium bodied with a big tangy texture and a long dry and tangy finish. 
Overall -the nose is quiet and then the taste builds and builds. Gnarly but gratifying.

7.4% ABV. Rye IPA.

Nice thick head of creamy tan bubbles. Deep golden amber color in the pour.

The nose is bold and obvious. Full of ripe passionfruit and blackberries. The sweet aroma of the malt is lengthened by the the rapidly evaporating esters of the aroma hops which give the fruity aroma an appealing ripeness.

Nice hoppy mouthful. You get a a very consistently fruity palate all the way to the end. The true genius of this brew is in the way the freshness of the bitter hops is balanced with the ripe fruit flavor notes of the aroma hops all teh way through. You usually get aroma then bitter, but not here. The flavor profiles of both hops are sinuously intertwined from fresh beginning to satisfying end. A very good effort. Satisfying to try. 

Thank you, Siren, Im developing a serious thing for just about anything you guys do...something about a song...
Started the new year off with this beer. Piney, hoppy, citrusy. Pretty well balanced. long bitter finish. Good :)
330ml bottle from Favourite Beer, Cheltenham. Hazy Amber colour, with a thin white head. Aroma has lychee, tropical fruit, hops and milk chocolate. Taste has a decent bitterness.
On tap Leggermente ambrata buona nota agrumata buona secchezza lieve astringenza resinosa buon amaro una nota piccante

Cobrizo  tupido  espuma marfil. Aromas  intensos cítricos, pomelo, lima y herbales más  atenuados.  Cuerpo medio, refrescante con sabor intenso y fresco  cítrico, lima y herbales con final de amargor moderado

Bottle from Theatre of Wine, Greenwich. Hazy orange pour with a white head. Thats a nice fruit laden nose- blackberries, black cherries, peach and mango. Smooth fruit flavours of citrus and berries with a whisper of corn. Good long bitter linger. Refreshing. Very nice indeed.

Draft at Euston Tap. Aroma is sweet and hoppy with some citrus. Pours pale amber with a small white head. Taste is nice and fresh and has a lot of hops. Palate is thin and oily, though very drinkable. Overall a nice beer, very fresh.

The color of the label is the color of the beer in the light. Very beautiful foam. Smells of mango and berries, perhaps a bit of raisins. Wonderful taste of hops, raisins, just balanced between sugary and smoky. A bit bitter on the palate afterwards but thats not unpleasant. Very full-bodied. A great one that I will certainly keep in my favorites.
Clean clear dark golden beer, with medium white head. Creamy as Siren beers usually are. Peach, orange and some mango. Bitter and bit malty end.

Tap at Euston Tap. Deep golden pour with a tight head. The nose is awesome. Really bright, citric aroma. A bit of soft spice and a fantastic integration of hops and malt. A bit like Hop Rod Rye (which isnt faint praise at all). Lean bodied with a bit of lemon and pine. Awesome.
Keg at Our Black Heart, Camden. Strong aroma of tropical fruits, pineapple. Taste is tropical, spiciness and a medium bitter finish. This is bloody great stuff!
Draft. Hazy amber color, fluffy cream colored head. Nice fruity aroma. Taste is fruit with a bit of spice, decent bitterness at the finish. Very tasty.

Aroma: grain malts, some citrus and tropical fruits. Appearance: slightly hazy, light, amber, small, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: bitters expand, grapefruit, some caramel and bread malts. Overall: quite a nice Speciality Grain beer, nice aroma. Bottle from Independent Spirit, Bath.

Keg at The Barton Arms, Bham 09/12/14

Golden Amber with a white fizzy head, Rye, Citrus, Hoppyness, Dry Finish. Doesnt taste 7.4%. More Siren Quality!
330ml bottle, murky golden beer with a small head, pungent citrus hop with dry, earthy notes, rye malt and a long bitter finish. Medium body, sticky texture with soft to average carbonation.
33cl bottle. Dark gold, brite, lacing off white foamy head, carbonated. Aroma: grapefruit, pine, a little earthiness. Flavour: lots of citrus tang. Assertive bitterness. Drying finish.
Bottle 0.33l at home, Helsinki. Best before: 30th May 2014. Colour is murky dark orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, pine, grain, hops and malts.

330ml bottle and a taster at The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey. Pours hazy amber with a fruity aroma. Taste is light tropical flavours, rye undertones with some grains, herbs and spice. Essentially quite fruity though,

Bottle. Pours a hazy amber with a white head. Sweet, slightly floral caramel aroma with a little woody rye stuff. Medium body, medium carbonation. Tangerine, pine, lemon, woody resin. light caramel, rye, grapefruit... Lovely balance. Tasty!

Keg at the Euston tap. Aroma is lovely fruity berry, mango, tropical with nice crisp grains. Light hazed golden orange coloured pour with a thin sticky white head. Flavour is composed of crisp earthy grains, light wheaty and straw. Hop character is earthy citrus lemon with a little tropical fruit and light resin. Bitterness is clean assertive and sticks around in the tongue. Palate is medium light bodied, nice and crisp with high carbonation. Finish is nice and dry. Nice IPA with decent grain character.
On tap at Craft beer co. Wow, tropical aroma hits you like a freight train. Balanced bitterness, aroma is tropical grapefruit, beer pours dark amber colour with very little head . GREAT BEER.

Amber beer with small head. Aroma of light spice, citrus and a little hop. Taste is sweet, tangerines, a little spice and some more hoppiness. Good stuff.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Orange hazy. Malty, slight bready caramels, sweet ripe orange on nose, some green lime citrus. Rather full bodied, bitter sweet. Sturdy, soft bitters, rye grainy finish. Pretty nice. A bit on the sweeter/fuller side, but I enjoy the rye grainyness.-- bb
Tap at mikkeller and friends. Hazy dark amber color, white head. Aroma is malty, lemon, sour, hops. Malty body, sour notes, lemon, cherry.
On tap at Crowbar. Golden-orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is orange, malt, hop, citrus. Flavour is orange, malt, hop, pine, citrus, yeast. Nice beer.
Bottle. Pours hazy amber with a creamy off white head. The aroma is spicy hoppy with peach, mango and gooseberry notes. Bitter hoppy and malty flavor with notes of exotic fruit.
Noe dunkel lys gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av sitrus, frukt, malt og gjær. Smak av honning, malt, sitrusfrukt. God bitterhet. Tap @ Melkebaren.
Nydelig frisk duft av citrusfrukter og honning. Dunkel gyllen farge. Hvitt skum, heng langs kant. God smak av citrus og honning, men dog noe vassen.
Amber coloured and hazy. Has a white head, mostly lasting. Hoppy aroma, herbs, citrus and mango. Flavor starts sweet, some burnt notes too, a bit odd. perhaps the multi-grain. Bitter finish.
grass, amber, hazy, off white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, long old finish.30052014
Bottle. Creamy head, punchy Spicey nose, caramel spice , citrus. Lovely rye.
Bottle from Lions Den, Yarm. A hazy red ale with a cream head. Nice and hoppy with tropical fruit notes and a fair bit of spiciness. Creamy with fruity notes too. Very good.

330ml bottle. Slightly cloudy, minimally reddish, amber colour with small to average, frothy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Citrusy hoppy, tropical fruity aroma, notes of mango, grapefruit, a sweaty touch of resin, slightly earthy rye background. Taste is citrusy and bitter hoppy, minimally earthy rye basis, fruity hoppy overtones with hints of grapefruit; lasting bitter finish. Rye interference bastardises the Simcoe and Mosaic.

Bottle at famous royal navy volunteer hazy mid amber with narrow frothy beige head. Fruity red berries and oranges peel on the nose. Medium bodied, fruity orange peel, cereal and bready notes at the back of the palate, finishing with an acidic moreishness. Decent.
Lovely rye IPA. Nearly perfect aroma and taste. Wasnt expecting this. Try it! ........
Smak och doft av humle, brunt socker, karamell, aprikos, persika, citrus och toner av granskott. Fin sötma, len och rund med god grapefruktsbeska.

On tap @ Crowbar. Unclear orange body with a small, dense tan head. Strong aroma of citric fruit, ripe fruit, some malt and quite much yeast. Flavor is sweet malty, some caramel, citric fruit, ripe fruit and pleasant bitterness. Fine balanced body and nice aftertaste. A nice, tasty, hoppy beer with a fine balance between malt and hops.

Pours a hazy murky brown with a large off white head, aroma is light earthy tones, little bit musky a touch medicinal, persevered lemons? Taste is great! Really well balanced slightly sweet beginning little of bit of pine makes it's way in with a mild to strong bitter finish. Alcohol hidden very well for a 7.5abv, medium mouthfeel. Really great beer

Sample thx to Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear darker blond beer, no foam.
NOSE: hoppy, fruity, florar.
TASTE: hoppy, fruity, florar, nice!

Shared a 33cl bottle from Mi-Orge Mi-Houblon. Pours a hazy brownish golden colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is fruity, yeast and caramel. Average to soft carbonation and light to medium body. Taste is medium bitter and light sweet with some dry finish. Overall, a very balanced and good beer.

Saturday 15th of February. Been on an all dayer in Manchester, proper mad one. Got off the train and on the way home stopped in the Redwillow bar. Concentrating on walking, sidled up to the bar for some reason going to attempt to sound well spoken. Growled incomprehensible rubbish and pointed to the pump. Scared young barmaid. Enjoyed this. I was in a right good mood. Fruity hop aroma and well balanced malts. Absolutely loved this, Yes, I was about as stupid as grown man could get at that point but I enjoyed the beer, no one got hurt but me and isnt that what beer rating is all about?

Bottle. Hazy dark amber pour with creamy offwhite head. Aroma is very balanced although complex with fruits and flowers. Taste has a solid bitterness. The malty base is also significant without being dominating.

Bottle 330ml
Clear amber color, small off-white head. Fruity, a bit citrusy aroma. Medium-bodied. Fruity, grapefruity, citrus in the flavor. Simple, good but simple.

33 cl bottle @ hotel room, copenhagen
Aroma has some sweet caramel tones and malt. Flavour is sweet with caramel, fruity hops and resiny tones. A bit straightworward and slightly too sweet.

33 cl bottle @ hotel room, Copenhagen.
Pours clear amber color with a small head. Aroma of resin, hops and sweet fruits, faint pine notes and hay. Flavor of resinous hops, caramel malts, toffee and pine. Rye on the aroma, not that much on the flavor. Drinkable.
3414

330ml bottle

Pours orange with a small white head. Aroma of crisp malts, hints of grass, citrus and tropical fruits. Taste is smooth, malty and crisp with hints of rye, grass, citrus and tropical fruits. Finish is grassy and citrusy with some crisp maltiness and rye notes. Okay.

Draught @ Crowbar & Bryggeri, Oslo
Pours hazy orange and off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, orange, caramel, peach, hint of rye and citrus. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long orange, rye and citrus finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Delicious. Citrus - orange and grapefruit - from the hops. With sweetness from the malt so the package evokes mango.

On tap at Crowbar. An unclear orange golden beer with a creamy light beige head. Citrus peel, pine cones and a malty touch in the aroma. Nice bitterness in the flavor, with citrus peel and pine cones. Full to medium body and a soft carbonation level. Lasting finish with bitterness and oranges. One dimensional but nice. 140501

Appearance: Orange brown, hazy. Some off-white head.
Aroma: Fruit, hops.
Taste: Fruits, bucket-loads of hops. Floral, wood. Long, bitter aftertaste.
Info: 330ml bottle, 26/4-2014, BB: 30/5-2014
Draft. Rich amber beer with a dark cream head. Grapefruit aroma. Grapefruit and pine flavor with earthiness. Medium bodied. Good bitterness. Grapefruit and pine linger with earth and light malt.

Bottle, cloudy amber with an off-white head. Aroma of malt and pine and tropical fruit. Nicely reproduced in the flavour plus malts, rye, orange peel and floral hops. Nice medium bodied mouthfeel. Smooth, with a nice bitter finish. Very good.

Bottle. Golden brown with an off white foam. Aromas are toffee and rye with pineapple and bready yeast. Red berries with hedgerow and woody pine. Flavours are red berries and barnyard with biscuit. Herbal with spices and bittersweet grapefruit. Fruity, malty IPA.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Siren Ryesing Tides ].Unclear matt medium orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, rye, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, orange - citrus, peach, light grapefruit. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, grapefruit. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140217]
Wow! Espuma perfecta. Aroma cítrico maltoso. Explosión de fresco amargor. Final amargo laaargo. Wow!

33cl BBF 30 May 14. 
Nose: citrus, pine, tropical fruits. 
Taste: more of the same from the nose, but the rye gives it a nice creaminess on the taste. Very enjoyable.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a cloudy amber with an off-white head. Subtle citrusy aroma, slightly greasy. Medium body, caramellish and nutty with a very sophisticated spiciness - rather unique actually. Gets a little ashy and dusty towards the finish. Ends very bitter. Delicious alright. 270314

Excellente balance entre des céréales machable et variés et une explosion de fruits tropicaux savoureux. Le corps est suffisamment robuste pour satisfaire la faim et suffisamment huileux et sec pour satisfaire la soif.

Bottle. Medkum high fluffy white head. Hazy dark amber body. Powerful dry grass pine grapefruit aroma. Smooth dry pine grass grapefruit flavor with a relatively powerful hops bitterness. Low carbonation. Long bitter finish.
Almost orange coloured with a small off-white head. Aroma is fruit, flowers and herbs. Taste is honey and fruit.

330ml bottle. Hazy orange-brown amber pour, thick foamy off-white head leaving lots of lacing and aroma of juicy mango, orange citrus, hoppy. Sweet malt caramel flavour balanced with tropical fruit, zesty orange & floral hop resin bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry earthy bitter finish. Very drinkable.

On tap at crowbar, Oslo.
Dark brass, creamy had. Very inviting fruity hop aroma, mouthwatering. Bittersweet flavour. Grass, basil.

Draft Farmhouse Grill & Tap. Color is a clear amber, thin lasting head. Nose is huge notes of tropical fruits. Pineapple, mango and maybe stone fruit. Flat or is balanced with malt and the juicy, fruity hops give a nice light bitterness that lasts for a good duration. Texture is oily with a brisk carbonation across the tongue. Damn, nice drinker!
On tap at Crowbar. Cloudy amber with a steady head. Potent citrussy nose, good bitterness throughout. Very bitter indeed.

Bottle shared @ Deans aged pale lager tasting, courtesy of deanso. Pours a hazy amber beer with a creamy, off white head on top. Aroma is grainy, rye, some earthy hops. Flavor has some earthyness to it as well, medium bitter and the rye influences are noticeable. Interesting, yet not very impressive.

Bottle shared thanks to Deanso. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of rye, fruity hops and caramel malt. Flavor is moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

33cl bottle from ABCBeers.
Thick white head. Hazy amber/blond pour. Nice fruity bitterness

Bottle. Hazy bronze, medium sized off white head. Lots of citrus and tropical fruits, straw, grain, pine in the finish, bark. Medium/full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Light alcohol heat in a pretty dry finish. Ok drinkability for the abv and knowing that Ryan had his dick in this makes the experience even more enjoyable.

Flaska på Bishops Arms, Sundbyberg.
Klassisk IPA färg, lite mörkare kanske. 
Doftar väldigt bra av simcoe, tropiskt och röda bär. 
Tycker bären sticker ut mycket i smaken. Bra IPA med fin beska!
Riktigt fruktig och fin öl med toner av hrapefrukt, trä, passionsfrukt och druva. Kroppen var stabil och balansen var tillfredställande!

Bottle from Kihoskh, CPH - pours a fuzzy medium amber colour with a small off-white head. Sweet citrus malty and hoppy, some caramel, some peach and apricot like nuance, slight spicy rye and hoppy notes at the end with a powerful bitter finish. Lovely.
Bottle at The Bottle Shop Canterbury. Hazy dark amber brown thin beige head. Citrus hoppy some sweet fruit quite juicy. Decent

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Hazy orange coloured with a small off-white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and exotic fruits with notes of pine needles and citrus.
Fruity flavour of hops, grapefruits and rye with notes of citrus peel.
Dry hoppy finish.

Bottle. Pours a pale amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy weak spicy rye aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy citrus hoppy bitter rye finish.

Bottle @ Johns, Pours slightly hazy golden with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, fresh fruity hops, peach, grapefruit. Flavor is malt, rye, rich fruity hops, peach, grapefruit, mango. Medium body, soft carbonation, lasting bitter finish. 170214

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy orange with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and rather hoppy - peach and grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 170214

Bottle. Hazy amber/brown with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, peach and pine. Flavour is malt, fruit, caramel, hops, citrus, peach, pine, little sweet, little grapefruit and medium bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy amber. Aroma and taste are rich hops, peach, apricot, citrus, malt and flowers.
@ Havregatan. Flaska inköpt i Köpenhamn. Grape, tall, tropiska frukter, humlig, ganska hög sötma, bra beska. Lång, besk och torr avslutning.
Flaske. Ravfarvet, lille off-white skum. Dufter dejligt - men lidt for flinkt og sødt - af frugtig us-humle. Masser af appelsin og pomelo. God fyldig mørk brøds-aroma og smag.

Bottle, bought @ Kihoskh, Cph.
Pours deep clear amber with a medium, staying, creamy, white head. Aroma has lovely exotic hops, apricot, galia melon, lemon, resin, bergamot with that fine rye spiciness in the back. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is fine, sweet caramel, spicy rye and good spicy hoppiness. Lemons, lots of apricot and peach. Lingering, powerful bitterness. Nice.
Lite blommig och smörig i aromen. Smaken bättre och kraftigare, hyffsad balans med besk eftersmak.

Bottle at home. Pours a clearish light amber with a medium off-white head. Sweet and quite bitter. Lots of sweet hops aromas with. Also some pale malts. Medium bodied. Medium carbonation. Long bitter finish.
Murky red-brown with a thin-medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus hops, resinous pine. Taste is light sweet, medium-strong bitter finish. Thick oily texture, light carbonation. Good.

Cask at CBC Clapham. Pours clear amber with a thick lace driven white head. Nose shows the rye beautifully. Big rye spice, earthy toffee and grassy hops. Taste is tangy and zesty with great rye spice behind it all. Great lime and grapefruit. Mild carbonation and a little slick. Solid as drop

330ml bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo.
In short: a kind of hoppy fruity ale.
Pours hazy orange with nice off white head, creamy one. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Caramel, berries, citrusy aromas. Oily texture, average carbonation, medium body. Taste is fruity, citrusy, some berries. Moderate bitterness and sweet aftertaste. Enjoyable.
Bottle. Pours hazy amber. Aroma is citrusy, tropical fruits, caramel and some malts. Flavour is quite fruity and hoppy. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Long fruity finish. Decent.
Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of citrusy hops, malt, caramel, and spices. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and straw, leading to a bitter finish.
33 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Peachy, citrusy, mango. Smooth fruity, mango and grapefruity. Lingering fruity and crisp hoppy. Smooth fruity. Bitter and bone dry finish.

Bottle at home - shared with Mette. Cloudy amber - white head. Nice bitterness, oiley hoppy, nice rye spicy notes, toasted notes, earthy mosaic hoppy, fruity, mango, ok grape fruits, ok tropical fruity hoppy. Lovely.
On tap at the Beer Emporium, Bristol 8/1/2014. Slightly hazy amber with a decent, off-white head. Tropical fruits, a touch of caramel sweetness, earthy malts, leading to a dryish finish. Good.

Bottle from Beermerchants. Pours unclear dark amber with a big creamy off-white head. Aroma of mint, grapefruit and oranges. Taste is moderate sweet resinous malty, lots of oranges and resiny oily hops to balance, a good cure for a cold coming sneaking in.

Botella de 330ml. Copa de Vino. Latón bruñido coronado por una cremosa y persistente capa de espuma amarillo marfil. Un sobresaliente perfil aromático que despliega pomelo, caramelos, maltas tostadas, resinas, piña con trazos de bosque y levadura; subyacentes perfumes cítricos y de frambuesas redondean el conjunto. Entrada cremosa, tostada, de pan negro y leve picante. Cuerpo medio/pleno y carbonatación suave. Textura densa. En el intermedio amargor cítrico que aflora y permanece sobre los granos tostados. Resinas y piña verde en el retrogusto con un ABV bien oculto. Refrescante y deliciosa!!
330ml bottle. Wine glass. Burnish brass headed by yellowish off-white foam. Creamy & lasting crown. Great aroma profile shows grapefruit, candies, toasted malts, resins, pineapple, hues of forest, yeast rounded by elderberries & citrics on the backside. Creamy, toasted, black bread & spicy upfront. Medium to full body. Soft carbonation. Texture is dense. Citric bitterness arises & remains over toasted grains. Green pineapple & resins on the aftertaste. ABV well hidden. Refreshing & delicious!!

Draught at The Rover, Göteborg, on January 11, 2014.Hazy copper color, teal head. Hoppy, alcohol, pine, citrus scent. Mineral, hoppy, wood, bitter, pine, resin taste. Resin, citrus aftertaste. Medium to smooth mouthfeel, though some dry wood. Medium high bitterness.

Draught at The Rover, Göteborg. Cloudy golden/grey beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Hoppy rye aroma, bready, hay, caramel, fruity, grassy notes. Hoppy floral flavor, caramel, ryebread, hay, floral notes, quite bitter. Hoppy grassy finish.

On tap @ Animal. Orangish colour with a white head, very good lasting and mild lacing. Aroma has notes of resins hops with fruity notes, mainly citrus. Flavor is very fruity with notes of peaches, grapefruit and bittery orange, good presence of resins hops with a good maltiness. The final has a decent bitterness with a good duration. Dense and creamy on palate with a ood body.

On tap at Man in the Moon, January 2014. 

Dark brownish/amber with a small head. Aroma of malt, fruit, grape, pine and some rye. The taste was better than the aroma, still a bit weak.

Cask at Cask Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico, London. A dark golden/amber coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Hoppy, tropical fruit, orangey aroma. Tastes quite rich, tropical fruit, orange, rye some caramel and hops in there too. Enjoyable stuff from the Siren chaps.

Draught @ Månen. Rather strange beer with a very anonymous (for the style) aroma - neither bitter nor sweet. Taste is rather messy with a lot of things going on at the same time. Too strong alcohol notes. The rye adds some smoothness.

Draught at Man in the Moon.
Pours reddish Brown. 
Very Heavy syrupy rye taste, some red berries and tropical fruits. Smooth mouth feel.
Cask at cask kitchen. Meh least fav Siren so far or maybe its just a cask thing......! Hoppy enough in the mouth but just a bit middle of the road for the bearded one.

Cask Half Pint at White Horse Old Ale Festival 2013, Parsons Green, London in Nov 2013 - Dark Amber in colour. Very Malty; toasty spicy rye, bready malts, toffee. Very Fruity; juicy orange citrus, tangerine, grapefruit. Hoppy; piney resinous hops. Great malt/spice/fruit/hop balance. Sweet bitter spicy malty citrus fruity throughout. Liked this a lot. Lovely Rye IPA!

Cask at the Sheffield Tap. Amber coloured, smooth thick golden head. Aroma is lots of fruit, peach, tropical, mango, orange. Taste is great, tropical fruit juice, pineapple, mango, lovely stuff. Really easy drinking, hides booze. IPAs/DIPAs are always going on about tropical fruit, but this one actually has it, and its got it in spades. Lovely.

Cask @ CPK. Brown with a tiny head. Lemon, citrusy hops on the nose. Strong caramel and peach cobbler. The taste is dominated by spicy rye. Brown bread. Light, nimble summery fruits provide a deft touch. More lemon. Medium body, soft carbonation. Nice stuff.

Bottle from The Beerhive. Hazy brown body with a medium off-white head. Great lacing. Aroma of mango, tangerine, kiwi fruit, Irn-Bru (thanks to Scopey for that) and caramel. Sweet flavour of whisky(?!), grain, melon, orange and spice. Quite boozy. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft carbonation. It doesnt quite live up to the aroma, and the 7.4% ABV is quite noticeable, but its otherwise very nice.

Cask at Cask Pimlico last week. Dark orange / red, clear bubbly white head. Smell - I have a slight cold so might be slightly off. Some incense, strong American hops. Body is medium, smooth, carbonation is low. Taste - spice, rye, American hops, lime cordial, grapefruit finish. Punchy bitterness. Seemed to be done well and its quite nice, but this isnt my style. Comparable to Hop Rod Rye but a bit better in my books.

Guest tap on The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Poured copper-amber in color with a nice off-white head! Hoppy aromas of pine, maybe grass, definitely some spicy rye notes. The taste was pretty much the same with some rye bread, maybe pineapple and some caramel added to balance the hoppiness. The body was extremely light, almost watery and carbonation was low to medium. A decent beer that needs a higher body and mouthfeel!!

20/12/2013 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Ambrata scarica, mediamente torbida, schiuma biancastra molto persistente. Al naso sentori di frutta tropicale, note pungenti erbacee ed agrumate, malto, cereali. In bocca lattacco è maltato, con note di cereali, amara nel finale molto lunga e persistente. Corpo medio-elevato, carbonazione media. Originale e ben fatta.

Keg at the brewery tasting room, Finchampstead, 14/12/13.
Clear orange amber with a moderate off white cap that stays for the show.
Nose is bitter orange, hops, lemon sherbet, hop notes, grass, bread dough.
Taste comprises bitter orange, caramel, rye bread, bitter citrics.
Medium bodied fine carbonation with a little prickle, dry grassy bitterness in the finish.
Drinkable affair.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Cloudy reddish brown. Aroma of grapefruit and pine with and overiding wack of spicy doughy rye amd caramel. Similar taste, strong rye flavour, caramel, toffee, biscuit and tropical fruits. Creamy texture with a bitter finish. Nice but I like the components better than the sum of its parts
On tap at Biercab. Amber colour with white head. Tropical fruits, caramel aroma. Fruity, resinous, caramel and malty taste. Medium body.

330 ml bottle.
Pours a dark amber colour with a small white head. Aroma of very juicy with orange, passion fruit and peach, with pungent citrusy notes. Rich flavour of piney bitterness, juicy fruitiness, tangy grapefruit, mild biscuity and bready notes and herbs. Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Sweet, exotic fruity finish. Drinkability is excellent. Great.
Cask at Pivni, York. Hazy amber. White head. Juicy hop character. Light spice. Zesty and dry. May have been close to the end of a barrel, I think. Shame. Potential to be a cracker.
On tap. Deep golden with white head. Aroma of grapefruit, grain, lemon peel, bread and slight perfume. Taste is grain, perfume, citrus and lemon peel . Nice
Bottled at NK Ölbar, Stockholm.  Hazy copper colour, small head. Rich grapefruit and mango aroma. Mid dry with medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Tropical fruits, peppered bread. Long bitter finish.

Bottle. Light hazy deep amber liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, bread, toffee, marmalade, mango, flowers and biscuit. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of citrus, mango, toffee and biscuit. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Quite nice.

Pouts dark amber. Aroma is peach, honey, apricit, grapefruit. Taste is peach, honey, apricot, resin, hay. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cask at White Horse Old Ale Fest 2013. It pours deep amber/brown with a small white head. The nose is orange, juicy tangerine, passion, Irn Bru, wood and spice. The taste is bitter-sweet, orange, passion fruit, marmalade, brown bread, rye, spice, resin and a good deal of bitterness with dry, citric finish. Medium+ body and moderate carbonation. Delectable orange citrus character and high drinkabilty. Great stuff!
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; cloudy copper pour with foamy beige head, pine hop aroma, taste has a lot of pine hop action along with passion fruit and a hint of rye spice impressive stuff.

Pours light cloudy reddish amber with two fingers of white head. Aroma of resin, grapefruit, peach, passion fruit, citrus... Brilliant! Taste is fruit and caramel sweet with a big bitter kick in the finish. The rye keeps it nicely balanced between bitter and sweet. Body is medium, creamy with average carbonation. A very, very good IPA!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle picked up directly fron Siren Brewery, Finchampstead; Berkshire, 20th November 2013 consumed at home Thursday 21st November 2013   Re: colour Loz suggests medium amber, I reckon hazy reddy amber with a creamy textured white head. Malty with a wonderful balanced spiciness. This is amazingly velvety in the mouth really soft, creamy smoothness very, very easy drinking beer. There is a pleasant hoppiness sweet small citrussy fruit, bit like clementine or satsuma with a light alcohol hit the spiciness is well integrated and there is a nice warmth this could almost be a hoppy christmas beer with the spicy hoppiness tempered by a lovely spiciness both in perfect balance. Cracking beer.  A7 A5 T8 P5 Ov15 4.0

Cask at the Tap East Second Anniversary Party - Stratford, London. Pours mostly clear amber-gold with a creamy white head. Vibrant aroma with tropical fruits, citrus, grapefruit in particular. Medium sweet flavor, good and resinous, with rich citrus fruits including grapefruit and orange. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Rich fruit finish, notes of melon, urine, grapefruit, restrained sticky pine. Excellent.

8th November 2013Tap East Birthday Bash. Cask. Lightly hazy amber beer with a small pale cream coloured head. Smooth palate with light fine carbonation. Nice rye malts, tasty and a touch spicy. Good orange marmalade with tangerine and lemon. Comes together very well before the smooth finish. Great combo of hop fruits and rye spice.

Cask at Tap East Anniversary Party. It pours amber with a small tan head. Aroma is intensely hoppy with lots of citrus and tangerine notes. Aroma is bitter and hoppy, some grainy rye notes, grass am citrus. Very very good.
Cask at The Alehouse in Reading. Sterling effort. The rye balances out with the gigantic resin hop beautifully.

Cask at the Hanging Bat. Aroma is great - juicy orange hops and rye spice. Taste is great too - fruity, juicy fun, orange hops, plenty of rye spice and loads of balance. Cask gives it a lovely full body. Kinda caramely texture, brilliantly balanced. This is how to do a RyePA. Mmmm.
330ml bottle. Pours brown with a large head. Aroma is juicy hops, papaya and melon. Taste has spicy, piney hops to start. Caramel and piney hop bitter finish.

Keg at Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Outstandingly good IPA. Rich, spicy bitterness from the rye. Big hops. Supremely smooth body. Smells and looks great too. This has lasting flavour right to the tip of every last drop.

Keg at Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a hazy medium amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is fresh grassy hop citrus fruit and spice. The flavour is medium bitter with a medium bodied liqourice spice palate.
Keg at Cotteridge Wines - Amber/copper, cream head, malty/ some spice, fruit and citrus.

Bottle at home, 31st October 13. Pilot version from brewery, thanks Darron. Pours dark copper brown, nice neat head. Aroma, is an intense mix of citrus and dark fruits. This is a fantastic beer, massive flavours, the rye comes though and other grain, lingering intense tongue tingling flavours. Great stuff

Cask at Hanging Bat. Pours clear golden orange, thin white head. Unexpectedly big fruit aromas, tropical fruit and citrus, some resin. Developing into cherrywood as it goes down. Light sweetness, pretty big bitterness. Slight boozy note on the finish, but otherwise very good.
Cask at the bat... Copper... Thin white lacing... Big juicy fruity nose... Zezty dry orange hop... Peachy fruits... Big juicy finish
